intro: Lavatera triloba subsp. pallescens, commonly known as the pale lavender bush, is a shrub native to Australia. It features soft, silvery-gray foliage and produces showy, pink or lavender-colored flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
